definition[0]: someone who does not arrive or appear somewhere they were expected to be, for example at a restaurant or a meeting
example[0]: The bad weather meant there were a lot of no-shows at the game.
definition[1]: someone who is expected at a restaurant to eat or at an airport to take a plane but does not arrive, or an occasion when this happens
example[1]: Most airlines guard against the threat of no-shows by overbooking flights.
